skill.name: empathy-ledger-dev
skill.description: Invoke this skill when: - Starting work on any Empathy Ledger feature - Need quick reference to project patterns
skill.summary: Invoke this skill when: - Starting work on any Empathy Ledger feature - Need quick reference to proj...
skill.author: Acurioustractor

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files. SKILL.md provides project context, code patterns, and reference materials. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution capabilities exist. All 76 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES caused by the analyzer misinterpreting markdown code formatting and legitimate documentation text as security threats.

content.value_statement: Developing platforms for Indigenous storytelling requires understanding OCAP principles, multi-tenant architecture, and cultural sensitivity levels. This skill provides the essential context, patterns, and frameworks needed to build compliant features for Empathy Ledger v2.
actual_capabilities: Provides project structure and architecture context for Empathy Ledger v2
Documents OCAP principles for Indigenous data sovereignty
Defines cultural sensitivity levels and their requirements
Lists Supabase database domains and type definitions
Describes slash commands and specialized agents available
Shows common code patterns for authentication and story ownership
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files directly
Does not access external APIs or services
Does not provide runtime debugging or monitoring
Context is specific to Empathy Ledger v2 codebase

use_cases.title: Build cultural UI components
use_cases.description: Create React components that respect cultural sensitivity levels and display appropriate badges and protocols for Indigenous storytelling content.

use_cases.title: Design tenant-isolated APIs
use_cases.description: Develop API routes with proper multi-tenant isolation, cultural approval workflows, and GDPR-compliant data handling.

use_cases.title: Plan culturally-safe features
use_cases.description: Understand cultural sensitivity frameworks to prioritize features that protect Indigenous narratives and data sovereignty.

prompt_templates.title: Create component
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the empathy-ledger-dev skill to help me design a React component for displaying story protocols. Show me the cultural color palette and sensitivity level patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Database schema
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to add a new field to the user profile. Use empathy-ledger-dev to show me the existing database domain structure and where to place the new type.

prompt_templates.title: Cultural review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this API route for cultural safety compliance. Use empathy-ledger-dev to check against OCAP principles and Elder approval requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-tenant setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me implement proper tenant isolation for a new feature. Show me the RLS pattern and tenant_id usage from empathy-ledger-dev context.

output_examples.input: Design a component for displaying cultural affiliations on a storyteller profile
output: Use the clay-* color palette for storyteller elements
Display affiliations with sensitivity badges (standard, medium, high, sacred)
Follow the ProtocolsBadge pattern from existing components
Check story ownership before showing restricted affiliations
Apply tiered access based on cultural sensitivity level

output_examples.input: Create a new API endpoint for story submission
output: Implement story ownership check before submission
Return proper error response for unauthorized access

output_examples.input: How do I implement GDPR data export for a user
output: Export all user stories with DistributionService
Revoke all external embeds before anonymization
Log the export action with AuditService
Verify tenant isolation before processing request

best_practices: Always verify story ownership before allowing edits or shares
Apply appropriate cultural sensitivity labels to new content
Use Supabase RLS policies to enforce tenant isolation
Include Elder review workflow for high and sacred sensitivity levels
anti_patterns: Bypassing cultural approval workflows for sensitive content
Storing sensitive stories without proper sensitivity labels
Sharing sacred content without Elder approval

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides context when working within the Empathy Ledger v2 codebase.

faq.question: What are the cultural sensitivity levels?
faq.answer: Standard allows general sharing, medium requires community context, high recommends Elder review, and sacred mandates Elder approval with no external sharing.

faq.question: How does multi-tenancy work?
faq.answer: All tables have tenant_id for isolation. RLS policies enforce tenant boundaries so organizations can only access their own data.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This is a documentation-only skill. It cannot access, modify, or transmit any data. It only provides context and patterns for development.

faq.question: How do I create a new API endpoint?
faq.answer: Use the /api-endpoint slash command with empathy-ledger-dev context. It will show authentication patterns and cultural compliance requirements.

faq.question: How is this different from generic Next.js skills?
faq.answer: This skill provides Empathy Ledger-specific context including OCAP principles, cultural safety patterns, and database domains unique to Indigenous storytelling.
